feed.title: Digital Transformation in Education
feed.subtitle: Digital Transformation is a strategy being used by industry to solve problems with smart, connected technologies. PTC Education works to bring these industry ready technologies to researchers and teachers around the world.

entry.title: September Newsletter
entry.content: <iframe src="/resources/Your August PTC Education Key Collaborator Newsletter!.html" height="1000" width="100%" title="September newsletter"> </iframe>

entry.title: Student Research Associate Summer Projects
entry.content:
The University Research Team at PTC Education had the pleasure of hosting a number of student researchers for a summer internship. See below for a list of projects and links to resources to help you recreate the student's work.



Topic Preview
This tutorial shows how to set up a ThingWorx Edge MicroServer on a Raspberry Pi running Octoprint for remote monitor and control of a 3D printer. Click here to learn more.

This activity guides students through a full process of collecting data to train a machine learning model, then deploying the model for an automated sorting task using a Universal Robotics colaborative robot arm. Click here to learn more.
Click here to see a library of examples on how to use the gaze vector in Vuforia Studio.

Click here to see Vuforia Studio templates for creating AR work instructions and computer vision applications.
entry.summary: The University Research Team at PTC Education had the pleasure of hosting a number of student researchers for a summer internship. See below for a list of projects and links to resources to help you recreate the student's work. Topic Preview This tutorial shows how to set up a ThingWorx Edge MicroServer on a Raspberry Pi running Octoprint for remote monitor and control of a 3D printer. Click here to learn more. This activity guides students through a full process of collecting data to train a machine learning model, then deploying the model for an automated sorting task using a Universal Robotics colaborative robot arm. Click here to learn more. Click here to see a library of examples on how to use the gaze vector in Vuforia Studio. Click here to see Vuforia Studio templates for creating AR work instructions and computer vision applications.

entry.title: PTC API Playground
entry.content:
The PTC API Playground is made to help you get started with using Onshape and ThingWorx REST API's using Python Notebooks hosted in Google Colab. This will allow you to write simple applications and macros that interact with Onshape and/or ThingWorx using the power of Python.




Check out the latest instructions for getting started with the API Playground at this page
entry.summary: The PTC API Playground is made to help you get started with using Onshape and ThingWorx REST API's using Python Notebooks hosted in Google Colab. This will allow you to write simple applications and macros that interact with Onshape and/or ThingWorx using the power of Python.

entry.title: DX in Education Summit
entry.content:
PTC Education hosted the Digital Transformation in Education Summit on May 19th!

Click here to see the full agenda for the event. Recordings of the keynote and panel sessions are below, and click here to see PDF's of all student posters at the bottom of this page.

DX in Education Summit Recordings

Presenter and Title Recording
Dr. Jordan Cox, SVP of PTC Education

PTC Technology in Education
Dr. Alison Olechowski, University of Toronto

Reimagining Design Education with Cloud CAD
Dr. Yuri Hovanski, Brigham Young University

Teaching Smart Manufacturing with Industry Ready Technologies
Dr. Chris Rogers - Tufts University
Anthony Nighswander - President and CEO of APT Manufacturing
Horst Orsolits - UAS Technikum Wien
Dr. Taskin Padir - Northeastern University

Teaching Robotics with AR and IoT
Dave Corcoran, Co-founder and SVP of Product Management at Onshape

CAD, Cloud, and Discruption

Student Posters

Digital Miniature Factory - Jürgen Altenriederer, UAS Technikum Wien

Onshape CAD Analytics: A Gold Mine for Studying CAD Designer Behavior - James Chen, UToronto

Some (Team) Assembly Required: An Analysis of Collaborative Computer-Aided Design Assembly - Kathy Cheng, UToronto

Smart Motors: Trainable Motors for Story Telling - Milan Dahal, Tufts

Analysis of a Closed-Loop Digital Twin - Andrew Eyring, BYU

A User-Friendly Digital Twin Package for UR Collaborative Robots - JT Frandsen, BYU

Implementing Virtual Twins for Robotics Design - Owen Gervais & Therese Patrosio, Tufts

AR for Advanced Learning - Ethan Gunn, BYU

Augmented Reality Instruction for the Machine Shop - Emma Higgason & Gabrielle Enns, MIT

Smart Factory Testbed - Nathan Hoyt, BYU

Identifying Computer-Aided Design Action Types from Professional User Analytics Data - Kevin Leonardo, UToronto

Augmented Reality in the Field of Nanotechnology Education - Megan Ngo & Tema Nwana, MIT

Introducing Reinforcement Learning to K-12 Students with AR and LEGO Robot - Ziyi Zhang, Tufts
entry.summary: PTC Education hosted the Digital Transformation in Education Summit on May 19th! Click here to see the full agenda for the event. Recordings of the keynote and panel sessions are below, and click here to see PDF's of all student posters at the bottom of this page. DX in Education Summit Recordings Presenter and Title Recording Dr. Jordan Cox, SVP of PTC Education PTC Technology in Education Dr. Alison Olechowski, University of Toronto Reimagining Design Education with Cloud CAD Dr. Yuri Hovanski, Brigham Young University Teaching Smart Manufacturing with Industry Ready Technologies Dr. Chris Rogers - Tufts University Anthony Nighswander - President and CEO of APT Manufacturing Horst Orsolits - UAS Technikum Wien Dr. Taskin Padir - Northeastern University Teaching Robotics with AR and IoT Dave Corcoran, Co-founder and SVP of Product Management at Onshape CAD, Cloud, and Discruption Student Posters Digital Miniature Factory - Jürgen Altenriederer, UAS Technikum Wien
